title: [Large-scale] Evidence-Based Language Teaching Methodology Workshop for Integrating Biomedical Engineering Curricula

context.prior_knowledge: Basic engineering and life sciences knowledge, foundational instructional design concepts, academic text comprehension and scholarly expression skills
context.additional_context: Participants engage to strengthen curriculum design competencies reflecting the interdisciplinary nature of biomedical engineering. Special emphasis is placed on bridging education-practice gaps by reinforcing language education elements like terminology systematization, technical documentation writing, and oral presentation training.

learning_goals: Participants can design one language learning module reflecting biomedical engineering practice cases (including text analysis, technical terminology explanations) using evidence-based teaching methods.

Participants can explain three or more language education strategies for integrating multidisciplinary knowledge (e.g., vocabulary expansion, concept explanations, reading-writing integrated activities).
Participants can develop project-based assessment tools (e.g., portfolios, oral presentations, writing assignments) to measure learner language outcomes as quantifiable metrics.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
